intro: Pomaria sandersonii, commonly known as the sanderson's pomaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink to red in color. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
